name: Mark White
description:
'''Mark Andrew White''' (born 1 April 1961) is an English singer, songwriter, composer, musician and record producer.

Born in [[Sheffield]], England, White first entered the music industry in the late 1970s as the lead vocalist and keyboardist of the [[Electronic music|electronic]] band [[Vice Versa (band)|Vice Versa]]. After releasing one studio album with the band in 1980, Vice Versa member [[Martin Fry]] emerged as lead vocalist and the band opted to transform into a new band called [[ABC (band)|ABC]]. White resigned himself to composing ABC's music while also playing guitar and keyboards before retiring from the music industry a year after the release of their sixth [[Album#Studio|studio album]], ''[[Abracadabra (ABC album)|Abracadabra]]'' (1991). As ABC's keyboardist he used a variety of instruments, including the [[E-mu Emulator]], the [[Yamaha DX7]] and the [[Fairlight CMI]].

In 2014, White came out of retirement to reform Vice Versa with [[Stephen Singleton]].
